intro: Alkanna sartoriana, commonly known as the Indian madder, is a flowering plant native to South Asia. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking red-orange roots, which are used as a natural dye. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often appearing in shades of pink or red. Alkanna sartoriana has been historically valued for its medicinal and dyeing properties.
